DataElement.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Hypercholesterolemia Lipid Condition Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no subjective repsponse provided by the patient regarding the occurrence of the presence of a condition involving elevated levels of cholesterol or lipid problems.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Hypercholesterolemia Lipid Condition Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient_Hypercholesterolemia; the presence of an abnormal amount of cholesterol in the cells and plasma of the blood._Lipids are fatty acid esters, an oily organic compound insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents._A state of being, such as a state of health._Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient:Hypercholesterolemia; the presence of an abnormal amount of cholesterol in the cells and plasma of the blood.:Lipids are fatty acid esters, an oily organic compound insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents.

Concepts.definition: Subjective reports made by a patient.
A laboratory test result indicating an increased amount of cholesterol in the blood.

A class of hydrocarbon-containing organic compounds. Lipids are insoluble in water but soluble in nonpolar solvents and play important roles in living organisms: these roles include functioning as energy storage molecules, serving as structural components of cell membranes, and constituting important signaling molecules. Lipids can be subdivided into 2 groups: fatty acids and glycerides.

Property.preferredDefinition: A state of being, such as a state of health.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A state of being, such as a state of health.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
